summary: Feodor Felix Konrad Lynen ForMemRS  was a German biochemist.
full_text:
Feodor Felix Konrad Lynen ForMemRS  was a German biochemist. In 1964 he won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine together with Konrad Bloch for their discoveries concerning the mechanism and regulation of cholesterol and fatty acid metabolism while he was director of the Max-Planck Institute for Cellular Chemistry in Munich.
^ a b Krebs, H.; Decker, K. . "Feodor Lynen. 6 April 1911-6 August 1979". Biographical Memoirs of Fellows of the Royal Society 28: 260. doi:10.1098/rsbm.1982.0012. JSTOR 769901.
title: Feodor Felix Konrad Lynen
